member.name: T:TwitchSDK.EventStream`1
member.summary: Represents an active EventSub subscription.
member.remarks:
You can have multiple concurrent subscriptions to the same event type. In that case, each event will be delivered to every single subscription.
Use to be notified immediately when the next event arrives. Whenever an event arrives even though you are not currently waiting, that event is buffered. Hence, keeping an open subscription but never receiving events from it produces a memory leak.

member.name: M:TwitchSDK.EventStream`1.WaitForEvent
member.summary: Wait for a new event to arrive.
member.remarks:
Invoking this function concurrently, i.e., calling it before an earlier invocation returns, is allowed. In that case, an incoming event is always delivered to the oldest currently waiting call.
We recommend that you only use OR for the same event stream, and not both. If you work in an Unity Update() function, using may be easier.
This function waits until a matching event arrives, potentially forever. To cancel the the call, terminate your subscription using .

member.name: M:TwitchSDK.EventStream`1.TryGetNextEvent(`0@)
member.summary: Returns a potentially waiting event. If there's no event waiting, this returns false, and no event.
member.remarks: We recommend that you only use OR for the same event stream, and not both. This function internally calls , and if there's no event, caches the for the next invocation of this function. This is useful for calling this e.g. in an Unity Update() function.

member.name: T:TwitchSDK.GameTask`1
member.summary: An awaitable Task suitable for games, where Result never blocks

member.name: P:TwitchSDK.GameTask`1.Task
member.summary: The underlying Task<T> object. Careful: properties and methods may block!

member.name: P:TwitchSDK.GameTask`1.MaybeResult
member.summary: Gets the result of the underlying Task if it's completed. Otherwise, it will return null.

member.name: P:TwitchSDK.GameTask`1.Exception
member.summary: Gets the AggregateException that caused the underlying task to exit prematurely. If the task is not completed or has completed sucessfully, this will return null.

member.name: M:TwitchSDK.GameTask`1.GetAwaiter
member.summary: Returns an awaiter, so you can await this, if you really want to.

member.name: T:TwitchSDK.GameTask
member.summary: An awaitable Task suitable for games, where Result never blocks

member.name: P:TwitchSDK.GameTask.Task
member.summary: The underlying Task<T> object. Careful: properties and methods may block!

member.name: P:TwitchSDK.GameTask.IsCompleted
member.summary: Gets wether the underlying Task has completed.

member.name: M:TwitchSDK.GameTask.GetAwaiter
member.summary: Returns an awaiter, so you can await this, if you really want to.

member.name: T:TwitchSDK.Interop.AuthStatus
member.summary: The current user authentication status.

member.name: F:TwitchSDK.Interop.AuthStatus.LoggedOut
member.summary: The core library is logged out.

member.name: F:TwitchSDK.Interop.AuthStatus.Loading
member.summary: The status can not be determined because an operation affecting it is currently in progress.

member.name: F:TwitchSDK.Interop.AuthStatus.WaitingForCode
member.summary: The authorization code flow is in progress and we are currently waiting for the user to authorize.

member.name: F:TwitchSDK.Interop.AuthStatus.LoggedIn
member.summary: We have valid OAuth credentials.
member.remarks: Note that these credentials may still be rejected if the user revokes your Client-Id from their account.

member.name: F:TwitchSDK.Interop.CustomRewardRedemptionState.Unknown
member.summary: There was an error determining the state of the redemption.

member.summary: The channel points reward has been redeemed and is now waiting to be fulfilled.

member.summary: The channel points reward has been fulfilled.

member.name: F:TwitchSDK.Interop.CustomRewardRedemptionState.Canceled
member.summary: The channel points reward has been canceled, and the channel points have been refunded.

member.summary: The Prediction has been locked and viewers can no longer make predictions.

member.name: F:TwitchSDK.Interop.PredictionStatus.Resolved

member.name: F:TwitchSDK.Interop.PredictionStatus.Canceled
member.summary: The Prediction has been canceled and the Channel Points have been refunded to participants.

member.summary: Poll has been manually terminated before its time.

member.name: F:TwitchSDK.Interop.PollStatus.Archived

member.name: F:TwitchSDK.Interop.PollStatus.Moderated

member.name: F:TwitchSDK.Interop.PollStatus.Invalid

member.summary: A Hype Train makes progress on the user's channel. Requires the channel:read:hype_train scope.

member.name: F:TwitchSDK.Interop.HypeTrainEvent.HypeTrainId
member.summary: The Hype Train ID.

member.name: F:TwitchSDK.Interop.HypeTrainEvent.BroadcasterId
member.summary: The requested broadcaster ID.

member.name: F:TwitchSDK.Interop.HypeTrainEvent.BroadcasterName
member.summary: The requested broadcaster display name.

member.name: F:TwitchSDK.Interop.HypeTrainEvent.Level
member.summary: The current level of the Hype Train.

member.name: F:TwitchSDK.Interop.HypeTrainEvent.TotalPoints
member.summary: Total points contributed to the Hype Train.

member.name: F:TwitchSDK.Interop.HypeTrainEvent.Progress
member.summary: The number of points contributed to the Hype Train at the current level.
member.remarks: Set to -1 when the hype train is over.

member.name: F:TwitchSDK.Interop.HypeTrainEvent.Goal
member.summary: The number of points required to reach the next level.
member.remarks: Set to -1 when the hype train is over.

member.name: F:TwitchSDK.Interop.HypeTrainEvent.StartedAt
member.summary: The time when the Hype Train started.

member.name: F:TwitchSDK.Interop.HypeTrainEvent.ExpiresAt
member.summary: The time when the Hype Train expires. The expiration is extended when the Hype Train reaches a new level.
member.remarks: This is empty when the Hype Train is over.

member.name: F:TwitchSDK.Interop.HypeTrainEvent.EndedAt
member.summary: The time when the Hype Train ended.
member.remarks: Empty if the Hype Train has not ended yet.

member.name: F:TwitchSDK.Interop.HypeTrainEvent.CooldownEndsAt
member.summary: The time when the Hype Train cooldown ends so that the next Hype Train can start.
member.remarks: Empty if the Hype Train has not ended yet.

member.name: F:TwitchSDK.Interop.HypeTrainEvent.TopContributions
member.summary: The contributors with the most points contributed.
member.remarks: Contains a maximum of two objects: one for the top bits contributor and one for the top subscriptions contributor (this includes gifted subscriptions).

member.name: F:TwitchSDK.Interop.HypeTrainEvent.LastContribution
member.summary: The most recent contribution.
member.remarks: This is empty when the Hype Train is over.

member.name: F:TwitchSDK.Interop.CustomRewardDefinition.IsEnabled

member.name: F:TwitchSDK.Interop.CustomRewardDefinition.IsUserInputRequired

member.name: F:TwitchSDK.Interop.CustomRewardDefinition.MaxPerUserPerStream

member.name: F:TwitchSDK.Interop.CustomRewardDefinition.IsGlobalCooldownEnabled

member.name: F:TwitchSDK.Interop.CustomRewardDefinition.GlobalCooldownSeconds

member.name: F:TwitchSDK.Interop.CustomRewardDefinition.ShouldRedemptionsSkipRequestQueue
member.summary: Optional. Should redemptions be set to status immediately when redeemed and skip the request queue instead of the normal status.

member.name: F:TwitchSDK.Interop.BitsLeaderboardEntry.UserId
member.summary: ID of the user (viewer) in the leaderboard entry.

member.name: F:TwitchSDK.Interop.BitsLeaderboardEntry.UserName
member.summary: Display name corresponding to .

member.name: F:TwitchSDK.Interop.BitsLeaderboardEntry.Rank
member.summary: Leaderboard rank of the user.

member.name: F:TwitchSDK.Interop.BitsLeaderboardEntry.Score
member.summary: Leaderboard score (number of Bits) of the user.

member.name: F:TwitchSDK.Interop.BitsLeaderboard.Data
member.summary: Entries on the bits leaderboard, in no particular order.

member.name: F:TwitchSDK.Interop.BitsLeaderboard.StartedAt
member.summary: Start of the date range for the returned data.

member.name: F:TwitchSDK.Interop.BitsLeaderboard.EndedAt
member.summary: End of the date range for the returned data.

member.name: F:TwitchSDK.Interop.BitsLeaderboardRequest.Count
member.summary: Number of results to be returned. Maximum: 100. Default: 10.

member.name: F:TwitchSDK.Interop.BitsLeaderboardRequest.Period
member.summary: Time period over which data is aggregated (PST time zone). This parameter interacts with . Default: all.
member.remarks:
Valid values:
day – 00:00:00 on the day specified in , through 00:00:00 on the following day.
week – 00:00:00 on Monday of the week specified in , through 00:00:00 on the following Monday.
month – 00:00:00 on the first day of the month specified in , through 00:00:00 on the first day of the following month.
year – 00:00:00 on the first day of the year specified in , through 00:00:00 on the first day of the following year.
all – The lifetime of the broadcaster's channel. If this is specified (or used by default), is ignored.

member.name: F:TwitchSDK.Interop.BitsLeaderboardRequest.StartedAt
member.summary: Timestamp for the period over which the returned data is aggregated. Must be in RFC 3339 format.
member.remarks: If this is not provided, data is aggregated over the current period; e.g., the current day/week/month/year. This value is ignored if is all. Currently, the HH:MM:SS part of this value is used only to identify a given day in PST and otherwise ignored. For example, if the value resolves to 5PM PST yesterday and is day, data is returned for all of yesterday.

member.name: F:TwitchSDK.Interop.BitsLeaderboardRequest.UserId
member.summary: ID of the user whose results are returned; i.e., the person who paid for the Bits.
member.remarks: As long as is greater than 1, the returned data includes additional users, with Bits amounts above and below the user specified by . If is not provided, the endpoint returns the Bits leaderboard data across top users (subject to the value of ).

member.name: F:TwitchSDK.Interop.ModifyChannelInfoRequest.GameId
member.summary: The current game ID being played on the channel. Use “0” to unset the game.

member.name: F:TwitchSDK.Interop.ModifyChannelInfoRequest.Language
member.summary: The language of the channel. A language value must be either the ISO 639-1 two-letter code for a supported stream language or “other”.

member.name: F:TwitchSDK.Interop.ModifyChannelInfoRequest.Title
member.summary: The title of the stream.

member.name: F:TwitchSDK.Interop.ModifyChannelInfoRequest.Delay
member.summary: Stream delay in seconds. Stream delay is a Twitch Partner feature; trying to set this value for other account types will return a 400 error.

member.name: F:TwitchSDK.Interop.ModifyChannelInfoRequest.Tags
member.summary: A list of channel-defined tags to apply to the channel. Tags help identify the content that the channel streams.
member.remarks: A channel may specify a maximum of 10 tags. Each tag is limited to a maximum of 25 characters and may not be an empty string or contain spaces or special characters. Tags are case insensitive. For readability, consider using camelCasing or PascalCasing.

member.name: F:TwitchSDK.Interop.ModifyChannelInfoRequest.ForceUpdateTags
member.summary: If is missing or empty, channel tags will not be altered by default (if is false). If is true, passing an empty (or missing) array causes all tags to be removed from the channel.

member.name: T:TwitchSDK.Interop.StreamQuery
member.summary: Describes a query for streams. All fields are optional.

member.name: F:TwitchSDK.Interop.StreamQuery.After
member.summary: Cursor for forward pagination: tells the server where to start fetching the next set of results, in a multi-page response. The cursor value specified here is from the PaginationCursor response field of a prior query.

member.name: F:TwitchSDK.Interop.StreamQuery.First
member.summary: Maximum number of objects to return. Maximum: 100. Default: 20.

member.name: F:TwitchSDK.Interop.StreamQuery.GameIds
member.summary: Returns streams broadcasting a specified game ID. You can specify up to 100 IDs.

member.name: F:TwitchSDK.Interop.StreamQuery.Languages
member.summary: Stream language. You can specify up to 100 languages. A language value must be either the ISO 639-1 two-letter code for a supported stream language or “other”.

member.name: F:TwitchSDK.Interop.StreamQuery.UserIds

member.name: F:TwitchSDK.Interop.ChannelSubscribeEvent.UserId
member.summary: The user ID for the user who subscribed to the specified channel.

member.name: F:TwitchSDK.Interop.ChannelSubscribeEvent.UserLogin
member.summary: The user login for the user who subscribed to the specified channel.

member.name: F:TwitchSDK.Interop.ChannelSubscribeEvent.UserDisplayName

member.name: F:TwitchSDK.Interop.ChannelSubscribeEvent.Tier
member.summary: The tier of the subscription. Valid values are 1000, 2000, and 3000.

member.name: F:TwitchSDK.Interop.ChannelSubscribeEvent.IsGift
member.summary: Whether the subscription is a gift.

member.name: F:TwitchSDK.Interop.ChannelSubscribeEvent.CumulativeMonths
member.summary: The total number of months the user has been subscribed to the channel. This is nonzero only for resubscriptions.

member.name: F:TwitchSDK.Interop.ChannelSubscribeEvent.StreakMonths
member.summary: The number of consecutive months the user’s current subscription has been active. This value is -1 if the user has opted out of sharing this information. This is nonzero only for resubscriptions.

member.name: F:TwitchSDK.Interop.ChannelSubscribeEvent.DurationMonths
member.summary: The month duration of the subscription. This is nonzero only for resubscriptions.

member.summary: Indicates if the subscription is a gift.

member.name: F:TwitchSDK.Interop.UserSubscriptionCheckResult.IsSubscribed
member.summary: Indicates if the user is subscribed at all. If this is false, all other fields are empty.

member.name: T:TwitchSDK.Interop.PlatformAbstractionLayer

member.name: T:TwitchSDK.Interop.CoreLibrary
member.summary: This class holds a reference to the C++ Core Library.

member.name: M:TwitchSDK.Interop.CoreLibrary.GetAuthState
member.summary: Query the current authentication state.
member.remarks: This call always returns immediately.

member.name: M:TwitchSDK.Interop.CoreLibrary.GetAuthenticationInfo(System.String)
member.summary: Start the authorization code flow. If a user is currently logged in, this does nothing. After a successfull call to GetAuthenticationInfo, subsequent calls will return the same AuthenticationInfo until the login is either completed or timed out.
member.remarks: Credentials are stored persistently, so after loggin in successfully and restarting your application, the library remains in the LoggedIn state.
member.param: The set of OAuth scopes you would like to request.

member.name: M:TwitchSDK.Interop.CoreLibrary.LogOut
member.summary: Log out.
member.remarks: This call always returns immediately.

member.name: M:TwitchSDK.Interop.CoreLibrary.GetMyUserInfo
member.summary: Gets information about the currently logged-in user's account.
member.remarks: If the user is not logged in, this also waits for a successful login.

member.name: M:TwitchSDK.Interop.CoreLibrary.GetUserInfoById(System.String)
member.summary: Gets information about a specific Twitch user account.
member.remarks: Returns an empty object if no such user could be found.
member.param: The account ID to query for.

member.name: M:TwitchSDK.Interop.CoreLibrary.GetUserInfoByLoginName(System.String)
member.summary: Gets information about a specific Twitch user account.
member.remarks: Returns an empty object if no such user could be found.
member.param: The login name to query for.

member.name: M:TwitchSDK.Interop.CoreLibrary.GetMyStreamInfo
member.summary: Gets information about the currently logged-in user's stream.
member.remarks: If the user is not logged in, this also waits for a successful login. Returns null if the user is currently not live.

member.name: M:TwitchSDK.Interop.CoreLibrary.QueryStreams(TwitchSDK.Interop.StreamQuery)
member.summary: Gets information about active streams. Streams are returned sorted by number of current viewers, in descending order.
member.remarks: Submitting an empty is valid and fetches the top streams currently on Twitch. Across multiple pages of results, there may be duplicate or missing streams, as viewers join and leave streams.
member.param: The query to submit to the API.
member.returns: An object containing the matching streams and optionally a pagination token to fetch more results.

member.name: M:TwitchSDK.Interop.CoreLibrary.CheckUserSubscription(System.String)
member.summary: Checks if the currently logged-in user is subscribed to a specific channel.
member.remarks: Required scope: user:read:subscriptions
member.param: ID of the broadcaster to check for.

member.name: M:TwitchSDK.Interop.CoreLibrary.CreateClip(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates a clip programmatically. This returns both an ID and an edit URL for the new clip.
member.remarks:
Required scope: clips:edit
Creating a clip can take up to 15 seconds.
If is false, the clip is captured from the live stream when the API is called; otherwise, a delay is added before the clip is captured (to account for the brief delay between the broadcaster’s stream and the viewer’s experience of that stream).
member.param: Whether stream delay should be added before capturing the clip.
member.returns: An object describing the new clip.

member.name: M:TwitchSDK.Interop.CoreLibrary.CreateStreamMarker(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a marker in the stream of a user.
member.remarks:
Required scope: channel:manage:broadcast
A marker is an arbitrary point in a stream that the broadcaster wants to mark; e.g., to easily return to later. The marker is created at the current timestamp in the live broadcast when the request is processed. Markers can be created by the stream owner or editors.
Markers cannot be created in some cases (an error will occur):
If the specified user’s stream is not live.
If VOD (past broadcast) storage is not enabled for the stream.
For premieres (live, first-viewing events that combine uploaded videos with live chat).
For reruns (subsequent (not live) streaming of any past broadcast, including past premieres).
member.param: Optional. Description of or comments on the marker. Max length is 140 characters.
member.returns: An object describing the new stream marker.

member.name: M:TwitchSDK.Interop.CoreLibrary.CreatePoll(TwitchSDK.Interop.PollDefinition)
member.summary: Create a poll on the user's Twitch channel.
member.remarks:
Required scope: channel:manage:polls
Creating a poll automatically subscribes to updates for this poll. Avoid unnecessary traffic by invoking at some point for every poll you create.
member.returns: An object describing the new poll.

member.name: M:TwitchSDK.Interop.CoreLibrary.WaitForPollUpdate(System.String)
member.summary: Wait for updates to a specified poll. Updates occur when users submit votes, and finally, when the poll ends.
member.remarks: Avoid calling this function on polls after they have ended, as they will no longer recieve updates at that point.
member.param: Id of the poll to wait for.

member.name: M:TwitchSDK.Interop.CoreLibrary.EndPoll(TwitchSDK.Interop.EndPollRequest)
member.summary: End a poll prematurely.

member.name: M:TwitchSDK.Interop.CoreLibrary.UnsubscribeFromPoll(System.String)
member.summary: Unsubscribe from updates for a specific poll.
member.remarks: You must not invoke this function multiple times for the same poll. Unsubscribing from polls is optional. Failing to do so results in unnecessary traffic, but will not cause any malfunction or memory leak.
member.param: Id of the poll to unsubscribe from.

member.name: M:TwitchSDK.Interop.CoreLibrary.CreatePrediction(TwitchSDK.Interop.PredictionDefinition)
member.summary: Create a Channel Points Prediction on the user's Twitch channel.
member.remarks:
Required scope: channel:manage:predictions
Creating a prediction automatically subscribes to updates for this prediction. Avoid unnecessary traffic by invoking at some point for every poll you create.
member.returns: An object describing the new prediction.

member.name: M:TwitchSDK.Interop.CoreLibrary.WaitForPredictionUpdate(System.String)
member.summary: Wait for updates to a specified prediction. Updates occur when users submit votes, and finally, when the prediction ends.
member.remarks: Avoid calling this function on predictions after they have ended, as they will no longer recieve updates at that point.
member.param: Id of the prediction to wait for.

member.name: M:TwitchSDK.Interop.CoreLibrary.EndPrediction(TwitchSDK.Interop.EndPredictionRequest)
member.summary: Lock, resolve, or cancel a Channel Points Prediction.
member.remarks: Required scope: channel:manage:predictions

member.name: M:TwitchSDK.Interop.CoreLibrary.UnsubscribeFromPrediction(System.String)
member.summary: Unsubscribe from updates for a specific prediction.
member.remarks: You must not invoke this function multiple times for the same prediction. Unsubscribing from predictions is optional. Failing to do so results in unnecessary traffic, but will not cause any malfunction or memory leak.
member.param: Id of the prediction to unsubscribe from.

member.name: M:TwitchSDK.Interop.CoreLibrary.ModifyChannelInformation(TwitchSDK.Interop.ModifyChannelInfoRequest)
member.summary: Modifies channel information for the currently logged-in user.
member.remarks: Required scope: channel:manage:broadcast

member.name: M:TwitchSDK.Interop.CoreLibrary.GetBitsLeaderboard(TwitchSDK.Interop.BitsLeaderboardRequest)
member.summary: Gets a ranked list of Bits leaderboard information for an authorized broadcaster.
member.remarks: Required scope: bits:read

member.name: M:TwitchSDK.Interop.CoreLibrary.ReplaceCustomRewards(TwitchSDK.Interop.CustomRewardList)
member.summary: Updates the set of available custom channel points rewards on a channel.
member.remarks:
Required scope: channel:manage:redemptions
If you enable any custom rewards, please clear them by invoking this function with an empty rewards list when the game terminates.
Note that removing rewards that still have pending redemptions will set those redemptions to .

member.name: M:TwitchSDK.Interop.CoreLibrary.ResolveCustomReward(TwitchSDK.Interop.CustomRewardResolveRequest)
member.summary: Updates the status of Custom Reward Redemption objects on a channel that are in the status.
member.remarks: Required scope: channel:manage:redemptions

member.name: M:TwitchSDK.Interop.CoreLibrary.SubscribeToEventStream(TwitchSDK.Interop.EventStreamRequest)
member.summary: Subscribe to a Twitch EventSub stream.
member.remarks:
You must periodically receive events from your event stream. You must call once you are done.
To avoid leaking memory indefinitely in this case, there is an internal limit of 512 buffered events per event stream subscription, as well as an internal limit of 64 subscription per event type in total. When the internal buffer of a subscription is full, incoming events will be discarded silently. When the subscriptions limit is reached, an arbitrary subscription of the same type will be closed, and a warning message will be logged.

member.name: M:TwitchSDK.Interop.CoreLibrary.WaitForChannelSubscribeEvent(TwitchSDK.Interop.EventStreamDesc)
member.summary: A notification when a specified channel receives a subscriber. This does not include resubscribes.
member.remarks: You may only call this with a subscription for the correct event type.
member.param: An object describing the subscription.

member.name: M:TwitchSDK.Interop.CoreLibrary.WaitForChannelFollowEvent(TwitchSDK.Interop.EventStreamDesc)
member.summary: A specified channel receives a follow.
member.remarks: You may only call this with a subscription for the correct event type.
member.param: An object describing the subscription.

member.name: M:TwitchSDK.Interop.CoreLibrary.WaitForChannelCheerEvent(TwitchSDK.Interop.EventStreamDesc)
member.summary: A user cheers on the specified channel.
member.remarks: You may only call this with a subscription for the correct event type.
member.param: An object describing the subscription.

member.name: M:TwitchSDK.Interop.CoreLibrary.WaitForCustomRewardEvent(TwitchSDK.Interop.EventStreamDesc)
member.summary: A viewer has redeemed a custom channel points reward on the specified channel or the redemption has been updated (i.e., fulfilled or cancelled).
member.remarks: You may only call this with a subscription for the correct event type.
member.param: An object describing the subscription.

member.name: M:TwitchSDK.Interop.CoreLibrary.WaitForHypeTrainEvent(TwitchSDK.Interop.EventStreamDesc)
member.summary: A Hype Train makes progress on the user's channel. Requires the channel:read:hype_train scope.
member.remarks: You may only call this with a subscription for the correct event type.
member.param: An object describing the subscription.

member.name: M:TwitchSDK.Interop.CoreLibrary.WaitForChannelRaidEvent(TwitchSDK.Interop.EventStreamDesc)
member.summary: A broadcaster raids another broadcaster’s channel.
member.remarks: You may only call this with a subscription for the correct event type.
member.param: An object describing the subscription.

member.name: M:TwitchSDK.Interop.CoreLibrary.CloseEventStream(TwitchSDK.Interop.EventStreamDesc)
member.summary: Close a Twitch EventSub subscription.
member.remarks: After the subscription is closed, trying to receive events from it is an error.
member.param: An object describing the subscription.

member.name: M:TwitchSDK.Interop.CoreLibrary.PrepareShutdown
member.summary: Prepare for shutdown.
member.remarks: You should invoke this function and wait for it to return before exiting from your game process. This function resets state associated with your session such as available channel points rewards.

member.name: T:TwitchSDK.Interop.CoreLibraryException
member.summary: Wrapper type for all exceptions thrown by the C++ Core Library.

member.name: T:TwitchSDK.Interop.MonoPInvokeCallbackAttribute
member.summary: Use this attribute to mark methods that will be called back from P/Invoke calls. iOS (and probably other AOT platforms) needs to have delegates registered. Instead of depending on Xamarin.iOS for this, we can just create our own, the iOS runtime just checks for the type name. See: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-gb/xamarin/ios/internals/limitations#reverse-callbacks

member.name: T:TwitchSDK.ManagedPAL
member.summary: A standard PAL implementation for .NET environments. You may inherit from this. and override methods as needed.

member.name: T:TwitchSDK.Poll
member.summary: This object represents a Poll.
member.remarks:
Use the property to obtain a snapshot of the current poll status.
For efficiency, invoke if you don't require the results of the poll. This stops the background worker that polls updates from the Core library.

member.name: P:TwitchSDK.Poll.Info
member.summary: The current poll status.
member.remarks: This property is updated automatically to reflect the current state. Note that it will point to a new object after each update, so keeping a reference to the returned object means that you will not see updated values.

member.name: P:TwitchSDK.Poll.PollEnded
member.summary: This task resolves as soon as the poll has ended.

member.name: M:TwitchSDK.Poll.WaitForUpdate
member.summary: Wait for the poll state to update.

member.name: M:TwitchSDK.Poll.FinishPoll
member.summary: Finish a poll prematurely.
member.remarks: This causes the poll to end immediately. Results are then shown to all viewers, as if the poll had timed out normally.

member.name: M:TwitchSDK.Poll.DeletePoll
member.summary: Cancel a poll.
member.remarks: This causes the poll to end immediately. No results are shown.

member.name: T:TwitchSDK.Prediction
member.summary: This object represents a Prediction.
member.remarks:
Use the property to obtain a snapshot of the current prediction status.
For efficiency, invoke if you don't require the results of the prediction. This stops the background worker that polls updates from the Core library.

member.name: P:TwitchSDK.Prediction.Info
member.summary: The current prediction status.
member.remarks: This property is updated automatically to reflect the current state. Note that it will point to a new object after each update, so keeping a reference to the returned object means that you will not see updated values.

member.name: P:TwitchSDK.Prediction.PredictionLocked
member.summary: This task resolves as soon as the prediction is locked.
member.remarks: Once the prediction is locked, you should resolve it to one of its outcomes.

member.name: M:TwitchSDK.Prediction.WaitForUpdate
member.summary: Wait for the prediction status to update.

member.name: M:TwitchSDK.Prediction.Lock
member.summary: Lock a Prediction prematurely.
member.remarks: This causes the Prediction to stop accepting votes immediately, as if the timer had expired.

member.name: M:TwitchSDK.Prediction.Resolve(TwitchSDK.Interop.PredictionOutcome)
member.summary: Resolve a Prediction.
member.remarks: Resolving a prediction is allowed even if it's not locked yet.
member.param: The winning outcome.

member.name: M:TwitchSDK.Prediction.Cancel
member.summary: Cancel a Prediction.
member.remarks: This immediately ends the Prediction and does not show an outcome or any results to viewers.

member.summary: Twitch OAuth Scopes.

member.name: M:TwitchSDK.TwitchOAuthScope.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Construct a custom OAuth Scope from a string.

Your OAuth Client Secret

member.name: M:TwitchSDK.TwitchSDKApi.ModifyChannelInformation(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Int32,System.String[])

remarks.para: All parameters are optional, but at least one parameter must be provided.

member.param: Pass an empty array to remove all tags from the channel.

member.name: M:TwitchSDK.TwitchSDKApi.SubscribeToEventStream``1(TwitchSDK.Interop.EventStreamKind,System.Func{TwitchSDK.Interop.EventStreamDesc,TwitchSDK.GameTask{``0}})
member.remarks: This function creates an EventSub subscription that buffers events. Make sure to routinely poll it for events using to avoid memory leaks. You should call as soon as you no longer wish to receive events.

member.name: P:TwitchSDK.TwitchSDKApi.Version
member.summary: Obtain the Core Library's version string.
